data.text: @JohnnyDrag @howappealing @smmarotta @MatthewStiegler @finedr1965 What’s the point in spending time figuring this out?
@JohnnyDrag @howappealing @smmarotta @MatthewStiegler @finedr1965 Apparently a lot of people already know who it was.

@JohnnyDrag @ChaseTettleton @howappealing @MatthewStiegler @finedr1965 It could be that there was truly some understandable misunderstanding that came out through the responses to the order to show cause.  The Court seemed to accept good faith given no discipline. But given what the Court knew at the time, an OTSC was more than reasonable.

@ChaseTettleton @smmarotta @howappealing @MatthewStiegler @finedr1965 The key fact here is that they moved to have the extra people show up, and the Federal Circuit denied the motion. Then the people showed up.

@smmarotta @JohnnyDrag @howappealing @MatthewStiegler @finedr1965 I suppose that’s my point - wasting everyone’s time, most important the Court’s, on something so insignificant is beyond me. The excercise of power for its own sake isn’t a good look in my humble opinion. 

The Federal courts have a well-deserved reputation as inhospitable.

@ChaseTettleton @JohnnyDrag @howappealing @MatthewStiegler @finedr1965 The Court, I presume, wanted to make it clear that it meant what it said in its protocols.  Putting the fear of God in some attorneys is how you do that.

@JohnnyDrag @howappealing @smmarotta @MatthewStiegler @finedr1965 Am I the only one who finds the time and effort spent working up a discipline case for *this* offense to be an utter waste of everyone’s time?

@howappealing @smmarotta @MatthewStiegler @finedr1965 If we have the right case, it seems they didn't appreciate the new rules, filed the motion last-minute, and may have been on planes or darn close when the motion was denied. I see a lot of folks get lost at the Fed Cir (but not exhibit such bad judgment).

@howappealing @smmarotta @MatthewStiegler @finedr1965 No.  You can get there with carefully-selected search terms in PACER, and then confirm it with some of the facts in the order. But now I'll check the MP3.
@JohnnyDrag @smmarotta @MatthewStiegler @finedr1965 Did you go back and listen to the Federal Circuit's recent in-person oral argument audio recordings to figure this out?
